Source file src/github.com/TIBCOSoftware/flogo-contrib/action/flow/script/fggos/linkexpr.go

     1	package fggos
     2	
     3	import (
     4		"strings"
     5	
     6		"encoding/json"
     7		"strconv"
     8	
     9		"fmt"
    10		"github.com/TIBCOSoftware/flogo-contrib/action/flow/definition"
    11		"github.com/TIBCOSoftware/flogo-lib/core/data"
    12		"github.com/TIBCOSoftware/flogo-lib/logger"
    13		"github.com/japm/goScript"
    14	)
    15	
    16	// GosLinkExprManager is the Lua Implementation of a Link Expression Manager
    17	type GosLinkExprManager struct {
    18		values map[int][]*varInfo
    19		exprs  map[int]*goScript.Expr
    20	}
    21	
    22	type varInfo struct {
    23		name string
    24		isd  int
    25	}
    26	
    27	type GosLinkExprManagerFactory struct {
    28	}
    29	
    30	// NewGosLinkExprManager creates a new LuaLinkExprManager
    31	func (f *GosLinkExprManagerFactory) NewLinkExprManager(def *definition.Definition) definition.LinkExprManager {
    32	
    33		mgr := &GosLinkExprManager{}
    34		mgr.values = make(map[int][]*varInfo)
    35		mgr.exprs = make(map[int]*goScript.Expr)
    36	
    37		links := definition.GetExpressionLinks(def)
    38	
    39		for _, link := range links {
    40	
    41			if len(strings.TrimSpace(link.Value())) > 0 {
    42				vars, exprStr := transExpr(link.Value())
    43	
    44				mgr.values[link.ID()] = vars
    45	
    46				logger.Debugf("expr: %v\n", exprStr)
    47	
    48				expr := &goScript.Expr{}
    49				err := expr.Prepare(exprStr)
    50	
    51				if err == nil {
    52					mgr.exprs[link.ID()] = expr
    53				} else {
    54					logger.Errorf("Error preparing expression: %s - %v", link.Value(), err)
    55				}
    56			}
    57		}
    58	
    59		return mgr
    60	}
    61	
    62	func transExpr(s string) ([]*varInfo, string) {
    63	
    64		var vars []*varInfo
    65		var rvars []string
    66	
    67		strLen := len(s)
    68	
    69		isd := 0
    70	
    71		for i := 0; i < strLen; i++ {
    72			if s[i] == '$' {
    73	
    74				isdefcheck := false
    75	
    76				if strings.HasSuffix(s[0:i], "isDefined(") {
    77					isdefcheck = true
    78				}
    79	
    80				ignoreBraces := s[i+1] == '{'
    81				var partOfName bool
    82	
    83				var j int
    84				for j = i + 1; j < strLen; j++ {
    85	
    86					partOfName, ignoreBraces = isPartOfName(s[j], ignoreBraces)
    87	
    88					if !partOfName {
    89						break
    90					}
    91				}
    92	
    93				if isdefcheck {
    94					isd++
    95					vars = append(vars, &varInfo{isd: isd, name: s[i+1 : j]})
    96					rvars = append(rvars, s[i-10:j+1])
    97					rvars = append(rvars, "isd"+strconv.Itoa(isd))
    98					i = j + 1
    99				} else {
   100					name := s[i+1 : j]
   101					// Workaround until we don't support old resolutions
   102					name = strings.Replace(strings.Replace(name, "{trigger.", "${trigger.", -1), "{activity.", "${activity.", -1)
   103					vars = append(vars, &varInfo{name: name})
   104					rvars = append(rvars, s[i:j])
   105					rvars = append(rvars, `v["`+name+`"]`)
   106					i = j
   107				}
   108			}
   109		}
   110	
   111		replacer := strings.NewReplacer(rvars...)
   112	
   113		return vars, replacer.Replace(s)
   114	}
   115	
   116	func isPartOfName(char byte, ignoreBraces bool) (bool, bool) {
   117	
   118		if (char < '0' || char > '9') && (char < 'a' || char > 'z') && (char < 'A' || char > 'Z') && char != '.' && char != '_' {
   119	
   120			if ignoreBraces && char == '{' {
   121				return true, true
   122			} else if ignoreBraces && char == '}' {
   123				return true, false
   124			}
   125	
   126			return false, ignoreBraces
   127	
   128		}
   129	
   130		return true, ignoreBraces
   131	}
   132	
   133	// EvalLinkExpr implements LinkExprManager.EvalLinkExpr
   134	func (em *GosLinkExprManager) EvalLinkExpr(link *definition.Link, scope data.Scope) (ret bool, err error) {
   135	
   136		defer func() {
   137			if r := recover(); r != nil {
   138				ret = false
   139				err = definition.NewLinkExprError(fmt.Sprintf("Error evaluting expression: %s", r))
   140			}
   141		}()
   142	
   143		if link.Type() == definition.LtDependency {
   144			// dependency links are always true
   145			return true, nil
   146		}
   147	
   148		vars, attrsOK := em.values[link.ID()]
   149		expr, exprOK := em.exprs[link.ID()]
   150	
   151		if !attrsOK || !exprOK {
   152	
   153			return false, fmt.Errorf("Unable to evaluate expression '%s', did not compile properly\n", link.Value())
   154		}
   155	
   156		ctxt := make(map[string]interface{})
   157		vals := make(map[string]interface{})
   158	
   159		for _, varInfo := range vars {
   160	
   161			var attrValue interface{}
   162	
   163			attrName, attrPath, _ := data.GetAttrPath(varInfo.name)
   164			attr, exists := scope.GetAttr(attrName)
   165	
   166			attrValue = attr.Value
   167			if varInfo.isd > 0 {
   168	
   169				if exists && len(attrPath) > 0 {
   170	
   171					//for now assume if we have a path, attr is "object" and only one level
   172					valMap, ok := attrValue.(map[string]interface{})
   173	
   174					if ok {
   175						_, exists = valMap[attrPath]
   176					} else {
   177						//assume its a map[string]string
   178						strMap, ok := attrValue.(map[string]string)
   179	
   180						if ok {
   181							_, exists = strMap[attrPath]
   182						}
   183					}
   184					//todo what if the value does not exists
   185				}
   186	
   187				ctxt["isd"+strconv.Itoa(varInfo.isd)] = exists
   188	
   189			} else {
   190	
   191				if exists && len(attrPath) > 0 {
   192	
   193					valMap, ok := attrValue.(map[string]interface{})
   194	
   195					var val interface{}
   196	
   197					if ok {
   198						val = data.GetMapValue(valMap, attrPath)
   199					} else {
   200						//assume its a map[string]string
   201						strMap, ok := attrValue.(map[string]string)
   202						if ok {
   203							val = strMap[attrPath]
   204						}
   205					}
   206	
   207					attrValue = FixUpValue(val)
   208				}
   209	
   210				vals[varInfo.name] = attrValue
   211			}
   212		}
   213	
   214		ctxt["v"] = vals
   215	
   216		logger.Debugf("Vals: %v", vals)
   217	
   218		val, err := expr.Eval(ctxt)
   219	
   220		if err != nil {
   221			return false, definition.NewLinkExprError(fmt.Sprintf("Error evaluting expression: %s", err.Error()))
   222		}
   223	
   224		return val.(bool), nil
   225	}
   226	
   227	// FixUpValue fixes json numbers
   228	func FixUpValue(val interface{}) interface{} {
   229	
   230		ret := val
   231		var err error
   232	
   233		switch t := val.(type) {
   234		case json.Number:
   235			if strings.Index(t.String(), ".") > -1 {
   236				ret, err = t.Float64()
   237			} else {
   238				ret, err = t.Int64()
   239			}
   240		}
   241	
   242		if err != nil {
   243			ret = val
   244		}
   245	
   246		return ret
   247	}
